title: Components of velocity for an acceleration object

content.question: Students are studying the motion of an object that is moving in the <math alttext="x y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-plane. The <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> components of the object’s velocity, <math alttext="v sub x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="v sub y " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, respectively, as functions of time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are represented by the graphs shown above. Which of the following is a correct claim about the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> components of the acceleration of the object and provides correct evidence to support that claim?

choices.label: <math alttext="a sub x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is positive and <math alttext="a sub y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is zero, because the final value of <math alttext="v sub x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is positive and the final value of <math alttext="v sub y " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is zero.

<math alttext="a sub x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is positive and increasing and <math alttext="a sub y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is negative and constant, because the slope of <math alttext="v sub x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is positive and increasing and the slope of <math alttext="v sub y " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is negative and constant.

<math alttext="a sub x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is positive and increasing and <math alttext="a sub y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is negative and constant, because the values of <math alttext="v sub x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> are positive and increasing and the values of <math alttext="v sub y " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> are negative and decreasing.

<math alttext="a sub x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>⁢</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is positive and decreasing and <math alttext="a sub y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is negative and decreasing, because the slope of <math alttext="v sub x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is positive and increasing and the slope of <math alttext="v sub y " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is negative and constant.

<math alttext="a sub x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is positive and decreasing and <math alttext="a sub y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is negative and decreasing, because the values of <math alttext="v sub x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> are positive and increasing and the values of <math alttext="v sub y " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> are negative and decreasing.

content.answer: <math alttext="a sub x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is positive and increasing and <math alttext="a sub y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is negative and constant, because the slope of <math alttext="v sub x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is positive and increasing and the slope of <math alttext="v sub y " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is negative and constant.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
